title: Londons teares, vpon the never too much to be lamented death of our late worthie member of the House of Commons, Sr. Richard Wiseman Knight and Baronet Whose hearse was upon Wednesday the 19th day of January, 1642. solemnly conducted from King-street in Westminster, through the Citie of London, to the parish of St. Stephens Coleman-street, by above two hundred apprentises, with swords and black ribbands, in funerall equipage; and with above four hundred citizens, all in mourning, with each man his sword in their procession.
author: Wiseman, William, Sir, d. 1643.
